intro: Galium microlobum, commonly known as smallleaf bedstraw, is a low-growing herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs with opposite leaves. The plant features slender stems that are often hairy and bear small, opposite leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are white or pale pink, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Galium microlobum thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
